distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.0 for RHEL 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.0.4 serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.0.3, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes, linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* An EAP feature to download server log files allows logs to be available via GET requests making them vulnerable to cross-origin attacks. An attacker could trigger the user's browser to request the log files consuming enough resources that normal server functioning could be impaired. (CVE-2016-8627)

* It was discovered that when configuring RBAC and marking information as sensitive, users with a Monitor role are able to view the sensitive information. (CVE-2016-7061)

The CVE-2016-8627 issue was discovered by Darran Lofthouse and Brian Stansberry (Red Hat).

Before applying this update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform installation and deployed applications.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: It was discovered that when configuring RBAC and marking information as sensitive, users with a Monitor role are able to view the sensitive information.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: EAP: Sensitive data can be exposed at the server level in domain mode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: EAP: Sensitive data can be exposed at the server level in domain mode

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: An EAP feature to download server log files allows logs to be available via GET requests making them vulnerable to cross-origin attacks. An attacker could trigger the user's browser to request the log files consuming enough resources that normal server functioning could be impaired.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: admin-cli: Potential EAP resource starvation DOS attack via GET requests for server log files
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
